results.title: Epigenetic dysregulation of energy homeostasis drives aortic valve stenosis that is treatable with metformin.
results.text_hl: Epigenetic dysregulation of energy homeostasis drives @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Valve_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001024 @@@aortic valve stenosis@@@ that is treatable with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Cashman TJ, Saheera S, Blau AE, Mensah Otabil E, Nagy NY, Samenuk TD, Fitzgibbons TP, McManus DD, Trivedi CM. Epigenetic dysregulation of energy homeostasis drives aortic valve stenosis that is treatable with metformin. JCI Insight. 2025 Sep 9;10(17):. PMID: 40923319

results.title: Metformin alleviates the calcification of aortic valve interstitial cells through activating the PI3K/AKT pathway in an AMPK dependent way
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ alleviates the @DISEASE_Calcinosis @DISEASE_MESH:D002114 @@@calcification@@@ of @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Valve_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001024 @@@aortic valve@@@ interstitial cells through activating the @GENE_PIK3CA @GENE_5290 @@@PI3K@@@/@GENE_AKT1 @GENE_207 @@@AKT@@@ pathway in an @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ dependent way

citations.NLM: En Q, Zeping H, Yuetang W, Xu W, Wei W. Metformin alleviates the calcification of aortic valve interstitial cells through activating the PI3K/AKT pathway in an AMPK dependent way Mol Med. 2021 Dec 11;27(1):156. PMID: 34895136
